titles: The reformation of the Church of England justified according to the canons of the Council of Nice, and other general councils, and the tradition of the Catholick Church being an answer to a paper reprinted at Oxford, called (The schism of the Church of England) demonstrated in four arguments, formerly proposed to Dr. Gunning and Dr. Pearson the late bishops of Ely and Chester, by two Catholick disputants, in a celebrated conference upon that point : in which answer the unworthy and false dealings of the papists are shewed, and the charge of schism returned upon them, and the Church of England proved truly Catholick and apostolick in her doctrine and constitution / by Dr. Saywell.
author: Saywell, William, 1643-1701.
publisher: Printed by John Hayes ... for Edward Hall ... and are to be sold by Luke Meredith ... [in] London,
notes: "'The Schism of the Curch of England demonstrated' has been attributed to both John Spencer and John Sergeant"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
keywords: Spencer, John, 1601-1671. --  Schism of the Church of England.
